football.name: Football
rules_and_regulations: The game is played with 11 players per team on a rectangular field.
The objective is to score goals by getting the ball into the opponent's net.
Matches are played in two halves of 45 minutes each, with a 15-minute halftime break.
Players (except goalkeepers) cannot touch the ball with their hands.
A match is officiated by a referee and two assistant referees.

common_injuries.name: Ankle Sprain
common_injuries.causes: Twisting or rolling the ankle during play
common_injuries.precautions: Wear proper footwear, ankle support, and warm up properly.

common_injuries.name: Hamstring Strain
common_injuries.symptoms: Pain, tightness, swelling in the back of the thigh
common_injuries.precautions: Regular stretching, strength training, and proper warm-up.

exercises.name: Agility Ladder Drills
exercises.description: A series of footwork drills using a ladder to improve agility and coordination.

exercises.name: Passing Drills
exercises.description: Practices short and long passes with partners or a wall to improve passing accuracy.

cricket.name: Cricket
rules_and_regulations: Each team has 11 players, and the match is played on an oval field with a rectangular 22-yard pitch.
The game consists of batting and bowling phases.
Runs are scored by hitting the ball and running between the wickets or hitting boundaries.
The bowler must deliver the ball with a straight arm.
A match can last 20 overs (T20), 50 overs (ODI), or 5 days (Test match).

common_injuries.name: Finger Injuries
common_injuries.causes: Impact from the ball while fielding or catching
common_injuries.precautions: Wear protective gloves, practice safe catching techniques.

common_injuries.name: Shoulder Injuries
common_injuries.precautions: Regular strengthening exercises, proper technique.

exercises.name: Batting Footwork Drills
exercises.description: Improves batting stance, balance, and footwork for better shot precision.

exercises.name: Bowling Accuracy Drill
exercises.description: Uses target markers to help bowlers practice precision in line and length.

basketball.name: Basketball
rules_and_regulations: Each team consists of 5 players on the court.
The game is played in four quarters of 10 or 12 minutes each.
The objective is to score points by shooting the ball into the opponent's hoop.
Players cannot take more than two steps without dribbling the ball.
Fouls include hitting, pushing, and obstructing an opponent.

common_injuries.name: Ankle Sprain
common_injuries.precautions: Wear supportive shoes, strengthen ankle muscles, warm-up.

common_injuries.name: Knee Injuries
common_injuries.precautions: Knee braces, proper training, avoid overuse.

exercises.name: Dribbling Drills
exercises.description: Enhances ball control using various dribbling patterns and speeds.

exercises.name: Shooting Drill
exercises.description: Practices shooting from different spots on the court to build accuracy.

tennis.name: Tennis
rules_and_regulations: The game is played on a rectangular court divided by a net.
Players score points by hitting the ball into the opponent's court.
Matches are played in sets; a player needs to win 6 games to win a set.
Players serve alternately after each game.
The ball must be hit within the bounds of the court.

common_injuries.name: Tennis Elbow
common_injuries.symptoms: Pain on the outer elbow, weakness in the arm
common_injuries.precautions: Proper technique, rest, use of elbow braces.

common_injuries.name: Shoulder Injuries
common_injuries.precautions: Shoulder strengthening exercises, proper warm-up.

exercises.name: Forehand and Backhand Drill
exercises.description: Works on the accuracy and power of forehand and backhand shots.

exercises.name: Footwork Ladder Drill
exercises.description: Improves lateral movement and quick footwork across the court.

hockey.name: Hockey
rules_and_regulations: The game is played with 11 players per team on a rectangular field.
Players can only use the flat side of the stick to hit the ball.
The objective is to score goals by hitting the ball into the opponentâ€™s net.
Matches are played in four quarters of 15 minutes each.
Physical contact, tripping, and hitting opponents are not allowed.

common_injuries.name: Concussion
common_injuries.causes: Impact with the ball or stick
common_injuries.precautions: Wear helmets, follow safety rules.

common_injuries.name: Knee Ligament Injuries
common_injuries.precautions: Wear knee braces, strengthen leg muscles.

exercises.name: Puck Handling Drills
exercises.description: Focuses on stick control and puck handling in different directions.

exercises.name: Shooting Practice
exercises.description: Practices shooting accuracy and power from various angles on the goal.

volleyball.name: Volleyball
rules_and_regulations: The game is played on a rectangular court with a net in the center.
Each team has 6 players on the court.
Players score points by hitting the ball into the opponent's court.
A team can touch the ball up to three times before sending it over the net.
A match is played to the best of 5 sets; each set is played to 25 points.

common_injuries.name: Finger Dislocations
common_injuries.precautions: Wear finger supports, practice safe techniques.

common_injuries.name: Shoulder Tendinitis
common_injuries.precautions: Strengthening exercises, rest.

exercises.name: Passing Drill
exercises.description: Enhances accuracy in bump passes to teammates.

exercises.name: Blocking Drill
exercises.description: Trains reaction speed and timing for successful blocks at the net.

rugby.name: Rugby
rules_and_regulations: The game is played with 15 players per team on a rectangular field.
Points are scored by grounding the ball in the opponent's in-goal area (try) or kicking it through the goalposts.
The game lasts 80 minutes, divided into two 40-minute halves.
Players can only pass the ball backward or laterally.
Physical tackles are allowed, but high tackles or dangerous play is prohibited.

common_injuries.name: Concussions
common_injuries.precautions: Wear protective headgear, follow tackling protocols.

common_injuries.name: Shoulder Dislocation
common_injuries.precautions: Strengthen shoulder muscles, proper tackling technique.

exercises.name: Tackle Practice
exercises.description: Improves tackling form and reduces injury risk during play.

exercises.name: Passing Drill
exercises.description: Develops teamwork and passing accuracy in motion.

golf.name: Golf
rules_and_regulations: The game is played on a large outdoor course with 18 holes.
Players use a set of clubs to hit a ball into each hole in the fewest strokes possible.
Each hole has a par score, indicating the ideal number of strokes to complete it.
Players take turns hitting the ball from the location where it landed.
The player with the lowest total score at the end wins.

common_injuries.name: Lower Back Pain
common_injuries.precautions: Strengthen core muscles, proper swing technique.

common_injuries.name: Elbow Tendinitis
common_injuries.symptoms: Pain in the elbow, weakness in grip
common_injuries.precautions: Use correct grip, stretch before play.

exercises.name: Swing Practice
exercises.description: Refines technique and improves balance for consistent swings.

exercises.name: Putting Drill
exercises.description: Enhances control and precision on the green.

swimming.name: Swimming
rules_and_regulations: The sport involves racing in pools or open water using different strokes.
Common strokes include freestyle, breaststroke, backstroke, and butterfly.
Swimmers must touch the wall at each turn and at the finish.
In relays, the next swimmer cannot start until the previous swimmer touches the wall.
False starts lead to disqualification.

common_injuries.name: Swimmer's Shoulder
common_injuries.causes: Overuse of shoulder muscles during strokes
common_injuries.precautions: Proper technique, strengthen shoulder muscles.

common_injuries.name: Knee Pain
common_injuries.precautions: Avoid overuse, strengthen knee muscles.

exercises.name: Freestyle Drill
exercises.description: Improves stroke efficiency and breathing technique.

exercises.name: Kickboard Practice
exercises.description: Builds leg strength and proper kicking mechanics.

wrestling.name: Wrestling
rules_and_regulations: The match takes place on a circular mat with specific boundaries.
The objective is to pin the opponent's shoulders to the mat or score points through takedowns and holds.
A match consists of two or three periods, each lasting 2-3 minutes.
Illegal moves include biting, hair pulling, and striking.
The wrestler with the most points or a pin wins the match.

common_injuries.name: Knee Ligament Tears
common_injuries.precautions: Strengthen leg muscles, wear knee braces.

common_injuries.name: Neck Strain
common_injuries.precautions: Neck strengthening exercises, proper technique.

exercises.name: Grappling Drill
exercises.description: Develops technique for controlling and pinning opponents.

exercises.name: Takedown Practice
exercises.description: Improves speed and precision in executing takedowns.

cycling.name: Cycling
rules_and_regulations: Cycling races are held on roads, tracks, or mountain trails.
Riders must stay within their lane or designated path during track events.
Drafting behind other cyclists is allowed in most races.
Helmets are mandatory for all participants.
The winner is the cyclist who finishes in the shortest time or gains the most points.

common_injuries.name: Knee Pain
common_injuries.precautions: Adjust bike settings, strengthen knee muscles.

common_injuries.name: Wrist and Hand Numbness
common_injuries.precautions: Wear padded gloves, adjust handlebar height.

exercises.name: Hill Climb Drill
exercises.description: Builds endurance and strength for uphill cycling.
